revision.text: ==Eastern Huasteca Nahuatl== ===Pronoun=== {{head|nhe|pronoun}} # {{non-gloss definition|third person}}; [[he]], [[she]] ===See also=== * {{l|nhe|ya}} * {{l|nhe|yahaya}} ---- ==Herero== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|hz|bnt-pro|*-dáca}}. ===Verb=== {{head|hz|verb}} # to [[abandon]] # to [[lose]] ---- ==Lozi== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|loz|bnt-pro|*-jáka}}, a variant of {{inh|loz|bnt-pro|*-jíbaka}}. ===Verb=== {{head|loz|verb}} # to [[build]] ---- ==San Miguel el Grande Mixtec== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|mig|omq-mxt-pro|*yáʔáʔ}}. ===Noun=== {{head|mig|noun}} # [[chili pepper]] ====Derived terms==== {{col3|mig |yaha ndúyu cāa |yaha tɨ́ndúú }} ===References=== * {{R:Dyk & Stoudt 1973|page=52, 78}} ---- ==Ternate== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|tft|[ˈja.ha]}} ===Verb=== {{tft-verb}} # {{lb|tft|stative}} to be [[weak]] ====Conjugation==== {{tft-conj}} ===References=== * {{R:tft:Hayami-Allen:2001}} ---- ==Toro== ===Noun=== {{head|tdv|noun}} # [[sun]] ===References=== * Roger Blench, ''[https://web.archive.org/web/20150421041007/http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/BC/Plateau/Alumic/Toro%20wordlist.pdf The Toro language of Central Nigeria and its affinities]'' (2012)
